meanings.sent1: The towel felt wettish after wiping the spilled water.
meanings.sent2: The grass was wettish from the morning dew.
meanings.sent3: She hung her wettish socks to dry on the radiator.
meanings.sent4: The wettish paint on the walls gave the room a fresh look.
meanings.sent5: The wettish sand clung to their feet as they walked along the shore.

meanings.sent1: His shoes were wettish after walking through the puddles.
meanings.sent2: The dog's fur was wettish after playing in the sprinkler.
meanings.sent3: The wettish umbrella couldn't keep them dry in the heavy rain.
meanings.sent4: The wettish soil made it difficult to plant the seeds.
meanings.sent5: The wettish cloth absorbed the spilled juice quickly.

meanings.sent1: The basement had a wettish smell after the storm.
meanings.sent2: The cake was wettish in the center from the frosting.
meanings.sent3: The wettish towel left a mark on the wooden table.
meanings.sent4: The wettish air made the room feel clammy.
meanings.sent5: The wettish sponge soaked up the excess water in the sink.
